intro: Polycarpon suffruticosum var. virens, commonly known as the green-stemmed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant has wiry, often hairy stems and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the warmer months. Its leaves are linear and slightly succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
